text:
Hey folks! <http://Scribly.io|Scribly.io> is looking to hire a hybrid copywriter/ account manager to look after our agency partnerships. If you’re looking for a flexible remote role with a small, growing team of really lovely people (even if I do say so myself), get in touch at <mailto:dani@scribly.io|dani@scribly.io> :heart:

AND, if you’re just looking for content marketing writing opportunities, drop me a line!

<https://www.glassdoor.com/employers/ec/jobManagement_show.htm?currentPartnerId=1299932&selectedEmployerId=0&profileId=0&redirectTo=JOB_SLOTS&jobListingId=3597320866>

attachments.title: Employer Center Sign In | Glassdoor
attachments.text: Log in to your Glassdoor employer account. Sign in to see who's viewing your profile, respond to reviews and more. Don't have an account? Sign up.

text: Hello! Not all of our members are guys. In an effort to be more conscious of the language we use to address each other, why not try “Hey, folks,” or “Hey everyone” instead?

attachments.title: VP of Marketing & Growth at Supply
attachments.text: CEO's note: This role is not for the faint of heart. It is both a strategic and tactical role designed for a marketing polymath that is not satisfied with being tied to one area of expertise. You will be responsible for the company's entire customer acquisition and retention efforts. Who We Are We'

elements.text: i asked len (the person hiring for this role) about your concerns:

text: <@UUH2ESL66> any info that you would've liked to see that was missing?

elements.text: any info that you would've liked to see that was missing?

text: <@U011UJX75PE> Fairly specific, but I'm always curious to know *exactly* how big the team I'd be working with is and how many other peers would have the same role. A 2-to-3-person team has a really different dynamic than a 6-person team, for example.

elements.text: Fairly specific, but I'm always curious to know
exactly
how big the team I'd be working with is and how many other peers would have the same role. A 2-to-3-person team has a really different dynamic than a 6-person team, for example.

text: <@UUVRZMH5K> what'd you think about len's response to the job spec?

elements.text: what'd you think about len's response to the job spec?

text:
<@U011UJX75PE> Not Ajdin, but I'll chime in anyway :grimacing:

I thought his response was honest (the role isn't for everyone) but my follow-up to that would be: How do you maintain and support high quality output while working at that velocity?

To me, it doesn't seem like something a beginner would excel at. And it doesn't seem like something an experienced content marketer would want any part in.

Hopefully the pay is commensurate with their expectations. Good and fast can't also be cheap.
